comment.author: 35277872@N05
comment._content: According to the Oct. 15, 1911 edition of the New York Times the Young China Association was located at 12 Mott Street (see link below). According to the article, the flag flying to the left of the US flag was a newly introduced design for the Chinese revolutionary movement. The negative is inscribed with the date "10/23/11.” I assume that this photo was made in October 1911. query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9803E... books.google.com/books?id=BBYrAAAAYAAJ&dq=Brooklyn+Da...
